programme.title: Red Dwarf

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Charity: Yes, it is the one with David Brent's famous dance! Tim gets his first kiss from Dawn - but it is for charity as Slough celebrates Comic Relief day.

programme.title: The Office

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Landlocked. The ice pack has a chokehold on the opilio grounds and captains across the fleet must make the call to stay or go. Some run, and others stay to battle the elements. S8, Ep13

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Fearless Leaders. One of the boats suffers a total blackout while navigating an iceberg minefield. Meanwhile Elliott gets a rude awakening, and a greenhorn learns a deadly lesson. S8, Ep14

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Release the Beast. Frustrations mount as more ice forces the Time Bandit off their fishing grounds. Meanwhile, the crew of the Northwestern fight to stop their boat from capsizing. S8, Ep15

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Bitter, Bloody End. The fleet head back out on the perilous waters of the Bering Sea for the final stretch of a merciless opilio season. Will they all make it back safely? S8, Ep16

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: After a frustrating day, the Ferals hit a gold hot streak. An injury rocks the Gold Timers, while Shane and Russell struggle with their homemade sluice. S6, Ep5

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Prospectors Jacqui and Andrew uncover gold in Queensland. The Poseidon Crew get some exciting news, while the Dust Devils spend big on new equipment. S6, Ep6

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Gold Timers fight back against gold thieves. Machinery problems continue to plague the Dust Devils, while Marcus is panicked when Linden goes missing. S6, Ep7

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bishop hires a bomb expert to blast the impenetrable rock that's blocking access to a rich opal seam. Meanwhile, the Misfits face avalanches and dust storms. S5, Ep10

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Mooka Boys risk being buried alive as they hunt for a legendary mine shaft. The Blacklighters are overwhelmed by choking dust on their bone-dry claim. S5, Ep11

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Scotty gets lost while exploring hidden tunnels on the Bishop's massive claim. Jack and Mickey are nearly crushed as the Tarantos try to move their machinery. S5, Ep12

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen attempt drilling for the first time with a 50-year-old exploration rig. Plus, the Mooka Boys go on a treasure hunt in a scorpion-riddled mine. S5, Ep13

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Young Guns rethink their black opal hunt when they face impenetrable mine walls. The Blacklighters' ambitious plan is threatened as their generator dies. S5, Ep14

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: It's Just Sex. When Janet and Herv are confronting their clutter, secrets concerning their sex lives are revealed. Can they save their house - and their marriage? S3, Ep15

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: A Bomb Went Off. Phyllis' neighbours are complaining about the rubbish outside of her home. Faye, who suffers from COPD, realises her hoard is killing her. S3, Ep16

programme.title: Body Parts

programme.title: Body Parts
programme.desc: They Look So Real. Anaplastologist Allison Vest helps a mother who lost her hands to sepsis. Plus, an old patient returns after her pet mistakes her prosthetic ear for a chew toy. S1, Ep2

programme.title: Body Bizarre

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Lady Luck. The baggage battlers head to an esteemed estate sale in St. Paul, where they bid on items ranging from automotive parts and a rare doll to a hockey mascot costume. S3, Ep3

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Cash Is King. The Baggage Battlers head to London, home to six airports, where Billy, Mark and the Martins compete for the lost and unclaimed bags of the rich passengers. S2, Ep3

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: California Scheming. The Baggage Battlers wage war at the crazy, eclectic Santa Cruz Lost Property Auction, where Mark brings in reinforcements to battle Billy over antique toys. S2, Ep9

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Grand Theft Auto. The Baggage Battlers head to the Tampa Machinery Auction to bid on 1000's of lost or seized vehicles. But will they unearth any gems amongst the lot? S2, Ep10

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Eye for an Eye. The Baggage Battlers are in Toronto for one of Canada's largest freight and baggage auctions. Billy makes one of his most shocking discoveries inside his winnings. S2, Ep11

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Daredevils. The Baggage Battlers travel to Toronto to bid on international freight and baggage. One of the experts finds an item manufactured by legendary daredevil, Evel Knievel. S2, Ep12

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Liar Liar. The Baggage Battlers attend a well-kept secret sheriff's auction in Shreveport, LA. Billy scores a touchdown with his winnings, while a local sheriff interrogates Mark. S2, Ep13

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Shock & Awe. The Baggage Battlers heads to the Louisiana Farm auction to bid on Americana collected for over 50 years. Mark misfires when he bids on the wrong item. S2, Ep14

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Bad Blood. The Baggage Battlers are back. Today they visit an auction in Red Hook, N.Y., to try to take home a piece of history. Will they succeed? S3, Ep1

programme.desc: Turbos And Tailgates. Andy loves a crazy car concept, turning an old ambulance into a Maryland sports-mobile. Then, he thinks outside the box to soup-up a car for his buddy in blue. S3, Ep9

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Two For The Road. Andy calls in help to get his 1932 Roadster up and running. Another project faces problems - combining parts from two Chevy trucks into a single 'FrankenTruck.' S3, Ep10

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Crushing Cars And Taking Names. Andy's yard sees some unusual additions. There's an iconic piece of military history, and a dinosaur-sized bulldozer that no one knows what to do with. S3, Ep11

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: A Pack Rat, A Rat Rod, And A Bug. Andy finds a 1931 Model A looking like it just drove out of a movie about the Mob, and a 1963 VW Bug that needs some love. S3, Ep12

programme.title: Kindig Customs

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: The Future Is Now. A '32 roadster bought for a client's wife is secretly shipped to Kindig It for upgrades and styling changes. A 2004 Hummer arrives for a futuristic redesign! S4, Ep14

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: The Secret Client. Dave is tasked with finding and transforming a 1967 GTO for a secret client from South Africa. Meanwhile, Dave buys back one of his first builds, a Karman Ghia. S4, Ep15

programme.desc: Barting Over: Bart moves into a downtown apartment of his own, and befriends famous skateboarder Tony Hawk (guest starring as himself). Also guest starring Blink-182.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Girl Who Slept Too Little: Lisa becomes plagued by nightmares when the council move the cemetery next door to the Simpsons' house.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse of Sand and Fog: Milhouse is annoyed when his parents get back together. Homer catches chicken pox.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Treehouse of Horror XVI: Bart falls into a coma and is replaced by a well-behaved robot. Homer takes part in a deadly TV game show. And Lisa turns into Albert Einstein.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge's Son Poisoning: Bart gets picked on at school for riding a tandem with Marge.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: See Homer Run: To make amends for dismissing Lisa's Father's Day gift, Homer dons a Safety Salamander suit for a campaign at her school - and ends up running for mayor.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do our favourite celebs - from Mo Gilligan to Bez - think of our top TV, from Handmaid's Tale to Tiny World, and Matt Hancock apologising - and then resigning - on the News?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers have been watching Married at First Sight Australia, Pangolin: Kulu's Journey, The Honesty Box, Silence Is Golden and Good Luck To You, Leo Grande.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do Britain's sharpest armchair critics think of Virgin Island, The Four Seasons, Race Across the World, The Piano, I Kissed a Boy and Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: The dating hopefuls include a builder who's finally ready for a concrete relationship, a naked bike rider, a pair of gamers, and a man who's been married five times already...

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Can Italian restaurateur Giovanni, who's 61, out-charm Fred? Can Jason see past prison officer Tyrone's ADHD? And does barber Chris smell good enough for dental nurse Debbie?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers have been watching Married at First Sight Australia, Pangolin: Kulu's Journey, The Honesty Box, Silence Is Golden and Good Luck To You, Leo Grande.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do Britain's sharpest armchair critics think of Virgin Island, The Four Seasons, Race Across the World, The Piano, I Kissed a Boy and Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen?

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Save Our Town: Gordon helps three businesses in Ellicott City, Maryland, which suffered flood damage in 2016 and 2018. The job is so huge that Gordon dumps the 24-hour time limit.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Lucas's violent behaviour causes concern, and Dillon's at breaking point. A former resident is behind bars, Rex faces an ultimatum, and Grace wakes from her coma with a shocking revelation.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sheep.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Luigi's: Gordon Ramsay travels to Orange County, Southern California, to try to save Italian restaurant Luigi's from disaster.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Park's Edge: In Atlanta, Gordon helps first-time restaurant owners Richard and Jorge, whose establishment is in trouble due to their constant fighting, poor food and bad vibes.

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Save Our Town: Gordon helps three businesses in Ellicott City, Maryland, which suffered flood damage in 2016 and 2018. The job is so huge that Gordon dumps the 24-hour time limit.

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: (1995) Charming family comedy-drama about a clever little pig who forms a close bond with a farmer and discovers a talent for herding sheep. With James Cromwell.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tangerine Factor: When Penny breaks up with her boyfriend, Leonard plucks up the courage to ask her out. And each of them turns to Sheldon for advice about their date.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bad Fish Paradigm: Penny opens up to a reluctant Sheldon after a less-than-stellar first date with Leonard, putting him in the awkward position of having to keep a secret.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Codpiece Topology: Seeing Penny out on a date with another guy sends a distressed Leonard rushing back to Leslie Winkle, much to Sheldon's dismay.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Barbarian Sublimation: Penny becomes addicted to an online game based on the world of Conan the Barbarian and begins to pester Sheldon for advice.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Griffin Equivalency: Full of confidence after being named one of People magazine's '30 to Watch Under 30', Raj hits on Penny and becomes impossibly arrogant.

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: (2011) The third movie in the sci-fi action franchise. The discovery of a spacecraft on the dark side of the moon sparks another battle between the Autobots and the Decepticons.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Kill the Alligator and Run: Homer thinks he only has four years to live. So he takes the family on holiday to Florida, but does something foolish and gets into big trouble...

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Dangerous Curves: Homer and Marge head to a log cabin for the weekend and reminisce about their early courtship.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Throw Grampa from the Dane: The Simpsons visit Denmark and all fall in love with it - except Homer. Meanwhile, Grampa needs a serious operation.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: The Italian Bob: On a trip to Italy to find Mr Burns a new sports car, the Simpsons get stranded in a village where Sideshow Bob reigns as mayor.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Missionary: Impossible: Homer pledges $10,000 to save his favourite British sitcom. But when the channel comes for the cash, he flees to a South Pacific island.

programme.title: New: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Brand new series - Ricker Than Fiction: The new series continues. Rick and Morty take Hollywood.

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Brand new series - The CuRicksous Case of Bethjamin Button: Beth and Space Beth get nostalgic.

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: (1987) Sci-fi thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A US commando unit gets trapped in the jungle by a murderous, seemingly invincible alien hunter. But they ain't got time to bleed.

programme.title: The Shape of Water
programme.desc: (2017) Guillermo del Toro's Oscar-winning romantic fantasy stars Sally Hawkins as a mute cleaning lady who develops feelings for a mysterious, aquatic humanoid while working in a lab.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: A Kid for Two Farthings
programme.desc: (1955) Carol Reed's charming film stars Jonathan Ashmore as a young, impressionable boy who mistakes a one-horned goat for a unicorn in London's colourful Petticoat Lane market.

programme.title: Gift Horse
programme.desc: (1952) War drama. Trevor Howard plays the captain of an ageing US warship, gifted to the British navy, which is chosen to lead the raid on Saint-Nazaire in 1942. With Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: (1965) William Whitney's brutal western. Two former Confederate rebels are offered their freedom if they can track, catch or even kill their former gang mates. Starring Audie Murphy.

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid
programme.desc: (1994) Kicking family action sequel. Hilary Swank takes on the karate kid soubriquet, as the venerable Mr Miyagi helps her to battle her teenage demons.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: The Predator
programme.desc: (2018) Unrestrained reboot of the franchise defined by a ruthless extraterrestrial killer whose name says it all... and it's had a DNA upgrade. All the better to kill you with, my dear.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: (2008) Outrageous comedy with Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly. When two 40-year-old man-children's parents marry, can the lads settle their differences and grow up? Strong language/nudity.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: (1984) It's time to put on make-up. It's time to light the lights. Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzy, the Blues one and the gang embark on a musical adventure as they try to make it on Broadway.

programme.title: Dr Who and the Daleks
programme.desc: (1965) A spin-off of the cult television series starring Peter Cushing. Backyard-inventor Dr Who finds himself stuck on the irradiated planet Skaro, home of the cold and metallic Daleks.

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the...
programme.desc: ...Neighborhood: (2019) Biographical drama starring Tom Hanks as 'Mister' Rogers, the much-loved host of a kids TV show, who becomes the subject of a cynical journalist's article on heroes.

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: (2017) Fantasy adventure sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black. Four teenagers are sucked into the Jumanji video game to complete a dangerous quest.

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi disaster with Halle Berry. A NASA bigwig, a disgraced astronaut and a conspiracy theorist are all that stand between the Earth and a plummeting Moon. But are aliens involved?

programme.title: The Innocents
programme.desc: (1961) Classic chiller with Deborah Kerr. A governess finds her two charges worryingly worldly. Are they possessed by spirits? Or is it all in her head? Based on Henry James's story.

programme.title: The Duke of Burgundy
programme.desc: (2014) Peter Strickland's acclaimed adult drama explores the fetishistic desires and balance of power within a lesbian relationship. Starring Sidse Babett Knudsen and Chiara D'Anna.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Howards End
programme.desc: (1992) Anthony Hopkins, Helena Bonham Carter and Emma Thompson star in James Ivory's adaptation of EM Forster's novel about two families, love, treachery and revenge.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Rami Malek discusses playing Freddie Mercury in the rock biopic about the rise of the band Queen.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: (1984) Kung fu thriller with Ralph Macchio and Pat Morita. Elderly handyman Mr Miyagi teaches new-kid-at-school Daniel how to stand up to the school bully. It all hinges on the crane kick.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Rami Malek discusses playing Freddie Mercury in the rock biopic about the rise of the band Queen.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: (2006) Comedy-drama starring Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep. A naive young woman lands a job as assistant to one of New York's most important, but ruthless and cynical, magazine editors.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Rami Malek discusses playing Freddie Mercury in the rock biopic about the rise of the band Queen.

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: (1992) Comedy starring Whoopi Goldberg. A casino singer who witnesses a Mob murder goes into hiding at a convent, where she soon has the choir rocking. With Maggie Smith.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
programme.desc: (2018) Rami Malek turns in an Oscar-winning performance as Freddie Mercury in this rollercoaster musical biopic of the late Queen frontman. Big tunes. Big drama. Bigger teeth.

programme.title: My Beautiful Laundrette
programme.desc: (1985) Stephen Frears' comedy-drama starring Saeed Jaffrey and Daniel Day-Lewis. An Asian Londoner gets help setting up a glam laundromat by his lover, a one-time fascist.

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: (2022) It's Predator, 1719 style. Amber Midthunder stars as a Comanche hunter who must save her tribe from an extraterrestrial threat in this action prequel. If it bleeds, you can kill it.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: There is fear at Home Farm, Sarah and Cain seek further guidance, and Nicola sees a new way of working

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria resolves to identify who put Gary in hospital, and his attacker tries to cover their tracks. Kevin makes out to Debbie and Tyrone that his cancer was unresponsive and he has to have further chemo. Meanwhile, Dee-Dee is charmed by a stranger in the Rovers, and Lauren worries about Aadi's motives

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: Noel and Liz Edmonds' River Haven business in Ngatimoti is still struggling, so the TV veteran and his team plan a huge celebration for car lovers to turn things around. Noel also hopes a VIP will agree to meet him for lunch, navigates problems with giant boulders in his energy garden, and has a romantic proposal for Liz

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Thunderball
programme.desc: Oscar-winning spy adventure starring Sean Connery, Claudine Auger and Adolfo Celi. A Nato aircraft has been stolen by criminal organisation Spectre and the world is threatened by its nuclear payload. Agent 007 is assigned to the case and the trail leads to the Bahamas and the sinister Emilio Largo.

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the seventh stage, a 197km route from St Malo to Mûr-de-Bretagne Guerlédan. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Jacopo Guarnieri and Alex Dowsett, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Eddie Kadi to try disco yoga, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a community fundraiser, and Heidi Phillip-Smith demonstrates more latte art

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef is joined by actor and entertainer John Barrowman and prepares a selection of sweets and treats, starting with his cheesy, gooey souffle Welsh rarebit muffins. Former Great British Bake Off semi-finalist Briony May Williams makes a miso caramel and pear chocolate layer cake, while Olly Smith picks a range of drinks that are perfect for an indulgent moment,

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined for a chat by Danny Jones of McFly and actress Maureen Lipman, while horticulturist Camilla Bassett-Smith and carpenter Wayne Perrey join forces to help bring bees back to gardens. Sheep herder Meirion Owen introduces us to his latest border collie protege, RSPB wildlife gardener Adrian Thomas gives a lesson in birdsong, and drinks expert Andy Clarke celebrates Shakespeare's 460th birthday.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by comedian Stephen K Amos, who is served a peach breakfast crumble. Jimmy is at the wildlife park when vet Henry is doing the rounds, while Shivi heads off on her adventures again to learn about agroforestry.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is cooking up a feast of delicious food for comedian Leigh Francis and Sue Cleaver from Coronation Street while also enjoying recipes from chefs John Hooker and Paul Rankin.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the low-cost staple that is rice, starting with crispy rice with two deliciously moreish toppings that are great for entertaining too.They follow this up with Thai mango sticky rice, a Thai beef salad with a roasted rice dressing, and crispy Persian rice with spiced chicken

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: Raymond visits Hillsborough Castle in Co Down, the official royal residence in Northern Ireland. He meets head gardener Claire and helps her with a spot of harvesting while learning about the gardens' extensive restoration, and also sees some of the extraordinary fruits grown there

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing Live from Newmarket
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of day three of the July Meeting from Newmarket, headlined by the July Cup. Plus, racing from York and Ascot. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Hayley Turner, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Mark Chapman, Gillian Joseph, Ryan Sidebottom and Fred MacAulay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Sweden v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' concluding match in Group C, held at Stadion Letzigrund in Zurich. Both these teams are already assured of their places in the quarter-final after wins over Denmark and Poland, but this contest will decide who tops the group. Germany have won 11 and lost just three of the 16 meetings between the sides, but it was Sweden who won the last high-profile contest involving the nations, prevailing 2-1 in the quarter-finals of the 2019 FIFA World Cup and going on to finish third in the tournament. They both enjoyed strong runs in the last staging of this competition in 2022, with Sweden reaching the semi-finals and Germany going one better, before both eventually succumbed to hosts England, and were the two pre-tournament favourites to progress from this group. With analysis from Eni Aluko and Vicky Losada, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Siobhan Chamberlain

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the low-cost staple that is rice, starting with crispy rice with two deliciously moreish toppings that are great for entertaining too.They follow this up with Thai mango sticky rice, a Thai beef salad with a roasted rice dressing, and crispy Persian rice with spiced chicken

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure, featuring the voices of Will Smith, Jack Black, Renée Zellweger and Robert De Niro. Little fish Oscar yearns for a life of celebrity, so he collaborates with a vegetarian great white to dupe fellow fish into believing he's a heroic shark killer.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actress Penelope Keith, actor Robert Lindsay and musical theatre star Marisha Wallace join Alan at Manor Farm. Plus, horticulturalist Camilla Bassett Smith brings colour to autumn borders, and the Love Your Weekend greenhouse makes its debut

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Live Pre-Season Football
programme.desc: Preston North End v Liverpool (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the friendly at Deepdale. Preston finished 20th in the Championship last term and will look forward to testing themselves against the reigning Premier League champions, who have further strengthened their squad over the summer by signing the likes of full-backs Milos Kerkez and Jeremie Frimpong and attacking midfielder Florian Wirtz

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: STV weather presenter Sean Batty explores more of the best places Scotland has to offer, beginning by travelling to the East Neuk of Fife. There he makes cheese, visits a secret bunker, has a dip in the Pittenweem tidal pool and learns about the wildlife and history of the Isle of May

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland takes a look back at the Ravenscraig steel plant in Motherwell and Jennifer Reoch learns about Edna Nellis, a pioneer of Scottish women's football

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Wales (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' third and final Group D match, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. England got their defence of the trophy off to a disappointing start with a 2-1 defeat at the hands of France, but then bounced back in style with a 4-0 win over the Netherlands. Wales are playing in their first Euros and have succumbed to three-goal defeats in each of their first two contests. The sides have not met since two FIFA World Cup qualifiers in 2018, when Wales earned a surprising goalless draw in Southampton, before the Lionesses prevailed 3-0 in Newport. With analysis from Emma Hayes, Karen Carney and Jayne Ludlow, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic adventure thriller, starring Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw and Richard Dreyfuss. The Atlantic resort of Amity Island is preparing for its lucrative summer season when death strikes in the form of a Great White shark. Rather than turn away business, Mayor Vaughn orders police chief Brody to keep the beaches open.

England got their defence of the trophy off to a disappointing start with a 2-1 defeat at the hands of France, but then bounced back in style with a 4-0 win over the Netherlands. Wales are playing in their first Euros and have succumbed to three-goal defeats in each of their first two contests. The sides have not met since two FIFA World Cup qualifiers in 2018, when Wales earned a surprising goalless draw in Southampton, before the Lionesses prevailed 3-0 in Newport. With analysis from Emma Hayes, Karen Carney and Jayne Ludlow, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic adventure thriller, starring Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw and Richard Dreyfuss. The Atlantic resort of Amity Island is preparing for its lucrative summer season when death strikes in the form of a Great White shark. Rather than turn away business, Mayor Vaughn orders police chief Brody to keep the beaches open.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube
programme.desc: The actress and presenter travels down the famous river, beginning in Germany's Black Forest. She explores the Danube Gorge in Bavaria, and meets memorable characters, including a beer-brewing nun. In Austria. Joanna also discovers the beauty of the Wachau wine valley and fulfils a dream to visit the Vienna Boys Choir, before Tom Neuwirth, also known as Eurovision winner Conchita Wurst - reveals more of Vienna

programme.desc: The chef is joined by actor and entertainer John Barrowman and prepares a selection of sweets and treats, starting with his cheesy, gooey souffle Welsh rarebit muffins. programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh

Sheep herder Meirion Owen introduces us to his latest border collie protege, RSPB wildlife gardener Adrian Thomas gives a lesson in birdsong, and drinks expert Andy Clarke celebrates Shakespeare's 460th birthday.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by comedian Stephen K Amos, who is served a peach breakfast crumble. Jimmy is at the wildlife park when vet Henry is doing the rounds, while Shivi heads off on her adventures again to learn about agroforestry.

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is cooking up a feast of delicious food for comedian Leigh Francis and Sue Cleaver from Coronation Street while also enjoying recipes from chefs John Hooker and Paul Rankin.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the low-cost staple that is rice, starting with crispy rice with two deliciously moreish toppings that are great for entertaining too.They follow this up with Thai mango sticky rice, a Thai beef salad with a roasted rice dressing, and crispy Persian rice with spiced chicken

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Sweden v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' concluding match in Group C, held at Stadion Letzigrund in Zurich. Both these teams are already assured of their places in the quarter-final after wins over Denmark and Poland, but this contest will decide who tops the group. Germany have won 11 and lost just three of the 16 meetings between the sides, but it was Sweden who won the last high-profile contest involving the nations, prevailing 2-1 in the quarter-finals of the 2019 FIFA World Cup and going on to finish third in the tournament. They both enjoyed strong runs in the last staging of this competition in 2022, with Sweden reaching the semi-finals and Germany going one better, before both eventually succumbed to hosts England, and were the two pre-tournament favourites to progress from this group. With analysis from Eni Aluko and Vicky Losada, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Siobhan Chamberlain

programme.desc: England v Wales (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' third and final Group D match, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. England got their defence of the trophy off to a disappointing start with a 2-1 defeat at the hands of France, but then bounced back in style with a 4-0 win over the Netherlands. Wales are playing in their first Euros and have succumbed to three-goal defeats in each of their first two contests. The sides have not met since two FIFA World Cup qualifiers in 2018, when Wales earned a surprising goalless draw in Southampton, before the Lionesses prevailed 3-0 in Newport. With analysis from Emma Hayes, Karen Carney and Jayne Ludlow, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic adventure thriller, starring Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw and Richard Dreyfuss. The Atlantic resort of Amity Island is preparing for its lucrative summer season when death strikes in the form of a Great White shark. Rather than turn away business, Mayor Vaughn orders police chief Brody to keep the beaches open.
